availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis E. Payne (Scott County, Kentucky, student and soldier)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Remus Payne. Resident of Scott County in 1850. Resided in household that owned twenty-seven enslaved persons. Student at college in Scott County, in 1860. Private in the Second Kentucky Mounted Infantry (Confederate). Prisoner of war. Released in prisoner exchange in Spring 1865. Lieutenant in the 5th Kentucky Cavalry.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District No. 1, Eastport, p. 416A. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District No. 1, Eastport, p. 573. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District No. 2, p. 20. Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), June 1, 1900, p. 5. Find A Grave, "Lewis Payne (1839-1879)," Memorial #60902251, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/60902251/lewis-elzay (accessed January 9, 2018).
